Council Member Jackson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 18, 2011 be adopted as printed by Council Member Mendez.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Mendez moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 18, 2011 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Nancy G. Chaffetz to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her reappointment to the New York City Civil Service Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 813 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Nancy G. Chaffetz, NYC Civil Service Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Withdrawing the nomination of Rudy Washington (M 334) from the City Council for its advice and consent regarding his reappointment to the New York City Civil Service Commission.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Withdrawing the nomination of Rudy Washington, NYC Civil Service Commission  (M 334)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Withdrawing the nomination of Charles D. McFaul (M 335) from the City Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the New York City Civil Service Commission.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Withdrawing the nomination of Charles D. McFaul, NYC Civil Service Commission (M335)

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Robert F. Nolan, Council candidate for designation and subsequent appointment by the Mayor to the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors to serve for the remainder of a five-year term that will expire on March 20, 2012.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Robert F. Nolan, NYC Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors.

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Elisa Velazquez as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Elisa Velazquez, New York City Lobbying Commission.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Koppell:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226 (g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 3738 Riverdale Avenue, Community Board 8, Application 20115344 TCX shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Café, 3738 Riverdale Ave, Bronx (20115344 TCX)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Vallone:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226 (g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 42-21 Broadway, Community Board 1, Application 20115336 TCQ shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewak Café, 42-21 Broadway, Queens  (20115336 TCQ)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to reinstate the privileges, formerly held by the Puerto Rican Resident Commissioner and other delegates, allowing them to vote on amendments and procedures in the Committee of the Whole.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs,  Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Member formally voted against this item: Council Member Halloran. 


The following 4 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Ignizio, Oddo, Ulrich and Vallone, Jr.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Congress to reinstate the privileges, formerly held by the Puerto Rican Resident Commissioner and other delegates, allowing them to vote on amendments and procedures in the Committee of the Whole.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the Council to join in an amicus brief to be filed with the United States Supreme Court in support of the Respondents in the litigation captioned McComish v. Bennett, for the purpose of supporting the Respondents’ position that the Court should uphold the trigger funds provision of Arizona’s campaign finance law.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Member formally voted against this item: Council Member Halloran. 


The following 4 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Ignizio, Koo, Oddo and Ulrich.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the Council to join in an amicus brief to be filed with the US Supreme Court in support of the Respondents in the litigation captioned McComish v. Bennett.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the United States House of Representatives to vote against H.R. 358, a bill which will severely restrict women's right to access abortion and endanger women's lives by permitting health care providers to deny life saving care in emergencies.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Vote against H.R. 358, a bill which will severely restrict women’s right to access abortion.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to evictions of elderly tenants.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Evictions of elderly tenants.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing operators of a motor vehicle an opportunity to pay the fine immediately.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Providing operators of a motor vehicle an opportunity to pay the fine immediately.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would provide a tax credit to commercial building owners who lease space to small business owners.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Provide a tax credit to commercial building owners who lease space to small business owners.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to a tenants bill of rights and responsibilities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Tenants bill of rights and responsibilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the recovery of relocation expenses incurred by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to a vacate order.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Recovery of relocation expenses incurred by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to a vacate order.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.4578 and S.2997, and the Governor to sign into law an act to amend the Vehicle and Traffic Law, in relation to establishing an intercity bus passenger service permit system in cities having a population of one million or more.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Establishing an intercity bus passenger service permit system in cities having a population of one million or more. (A.4578/S.2997)

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the importance of financial aid opportunities for students to pursue higher education and designating the month of February as “Financial Aid Awareness Month.”
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Financial Aid Awareness Month.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States House of Representatives to vote against H.R. 3, a bill which will raise taxes on millions of Americans and severely limit women's right to access abortion services.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Vote against H.R. 3, a bill which will raise taxes on millions of Americans and severely limit women’s right to access abortion services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the New York State Governor to sign into law legislation that would require that paper ballots be designed in a more user-friendly manner.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Require that paper ballots be designed in a more user-friendly manner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring city contractors and subcontractors to post information concerning their employees' reporting of fraud, false claims, criminality or corruption and their whistleblower protection rights.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Requiring city contractors and subcontractors to post information concerning their employees' reporting of fraud, false claims, criminality or corruption and their whistleblower protection rights.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the mayor's office of veterans' affairs and the establishment of veteran liaisons.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Mayor's office of veterans' affairs and the establishment of veteran liaisons.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States House of Representatives to vote against H.R. 217, a bill that will restrict access to women's reproductive health services by severely restricting funding for family planning providers and the United States Senate to protect family planning funds and reject the total defunding of Planned Parenthood.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Vote against H.R. 217, a bill that will restrict access to women’s reproductive health services by severely restricting funding for family planning providers.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the duties and obligations of property owners with respect to maintenance, repair or construction of sidewalks as part of government capital reconstruction projects.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Duties and obligations of property owners with respect to maintenance, repair or construction of sidewalks as part of government capital reconstruction projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to informing of removal of trees.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Informing of removal of trees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing civil penalties for owning or harboring a dangerous dog.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Increasing civil penalties for owning of harboring a dangerous dog.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing certain parking privileges for press vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Providing certain parking privileges for press vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass H.R.4356, the “Downed Animal and Food Safety Protection Act,” which would amend the Humane Methods of Livestock Slaughter Act of 1958 to ensure the humane slaughter of non-ambulatory livestock, thus preventing such meat from entering the human food supply.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: “Downed Animal and Food Safety Protection Act” (H.R.4356)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass the “Thomas J. Manton Prostate Cancer Early Detection and Treatment Act of 2009” (H.R. 4383), which would amend the Public Health Service Act and Title XIX of the Social Security Act to provide for a screening and treatment program for prostate cancer in the same manner as is provided for breast and cervical cancer.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: “Thomas J. Manton Prostate Cancer Early Detection and Treatment Act of 2009” (H.R. 4383)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign the Preservation of Antibiotics for Medical Treatment Act, legislation that would prohibit the routine use of certain types of antibiotics in farm animals in an effort to reduce the spread of dangerous bacteria in humans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass and the President to sign the Preservation of Antibiotics for Medical Treatment Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass S.1075 and A.1929,  an act to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to forfeiture of pension rights or retirement benefits upon conviction of certain crimes related to public employment.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to forfeiture of pension rights or retirement benefits upon conviction of certain crimes related to public employment. (S.1075/A.1929)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter, in relation to the evaluation of depository banks.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Evaluation of depository banks.

Items.Title: Pursuant to §3-212(e) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council of the City of New York and the Mayor are empowered to jointly appoint five members to serve on the New York City Lobbying Commission.  In addition, the Council and the Mayor jointly designate a Chair from among the Commission members.  The Council will consider the appointment of Elisa Velazquez as a member of the New York City Lobbying Commission.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Elisa Velazquez, New York City Lobbying Commission.

Items.Title: Robert F. Nolan, Council candidate for designation and subsequent appointment by the Mayor to the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors to serve for the remainder of a five-year term that will expire on March 20, 2012.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Robert F. Nolan, NYC Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:



LU No.238 & Res No. 678, 50-1-0.

See files for individual votes.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, March 2, 2011.



MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
